column4: it is possible that this record be record automaticaly without ask the client
but i need
i'm executing an remote script that have to connect to another host and recover an a file, so i can not say yes in that script
but this script is for all the servers that we have in our farm
i create an private key that copy in all new instances to connect to the main host to get the file
but the first time that this machine go to connect he ask him if he are really sure to establish the connection
and i want avoid that
i'm using a software to scale servers and this execute script remotely so have to do everything preprograming
as said yes when stablish the first ssh connection
somebody know how avoid have to say yes the first time that you establish a ssh connection between two mahines with private/public key??
I believe  you can use: ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no     to prevent it from asking you whether you want to connect.
can we use that with Rsync?
Yes.  Use the -e argument to specify the ssh command.
thank you very much
how do you said it to use this option in the rsync?????
rsync -e "ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"

sorry man, using this line he still ask me for the confirmation rsync -e "ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -ave ssh ubuntu@ec2-79-125-96-101.eu-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com:/home/ubuntu/lcds_cv/ /tmp/lcds_cv/
Remove the second -e argument.
rsync -e "ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -avubuntu@ec2-79-125-96-101.eu-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com:/home/ubuntu/lcds_cv/ /tmp/lcds_cv/
(fixed) rsync -e "ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no" -av ubuntu@ec2-79-125-96-101.eu-west-1.compute.amazonaws.com:/home/ubuntu/lcds_cv/ /tmp/lcds_cv/
thanks man, work perfectly!
